title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no label after fn', compiler/rustc_span/src/source_map.rs:958:18

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm seeing an internal compiler error on the following input, found by [fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/dwrensha/fuzz-rustc): ### Code ```rust fn�a(){fn�p(){e}} ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) error: unknown start of token: \u{fffd} --> src/lib.rs:1:3 | 1 | fn�a(){fn�p(){e}} | ^ error: unknown start of token: \u{fffd} --> src/lib.rs:1:13 | 1 | fn�a(){fn�p(){e}} | ^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no label after fn', compiler/rustc_span/src/source_map.rs:958:18 ``` The ICE happens after correctly reporting the error "unknown start of token", so low priority. I guess that one part of the code treats `�` as whitespace, while another part of the code treats it as not whitespace, causing a logic error with this input. Affected versions: nightly 2022-02-26 and beta 1.60.0-beta1 are affected, but stable 1.59.0 does not ICE.
Backtrace
